chapter_metadata.subject: English
chapter_metadata.chapter_name: The Man who Thinks he can...

questions.question: Who is the poet of 'The Man who Thinks he can...'?
questions.answer: Walter D. Wintle

questions.question: According to the poem, if you think you are beaten, ______.
questions.answer: You are

questions.question: What is essential to have before you can win a prize?
questions.answer: Surety of yourself

questions.question: Success begins with a fellow's ______.
questions.answer: Will

questions.question: In the poem, what does 'will' mean?

options.text: The power of a person's mind

questions.answer: The power of a person's mind

questions.question: Where is it all found, according to the poem?
questions.answer: In the state of mind

questions.question: Life's battles don't always go to the ______ man.
questions.answer: Stronger or faster

questions.question: What is the short form of 'will not'?
questions.answer: won't

questions.question: What does 'outclassed' mean?

options.text: When others do better than you

questions.answer: When others do better than you

questions.question: The man who wins is the man who ______.
questions.answer: thinks he can

questions.question: What is the full form of 'you're'?
questions.answer: you are

questions.question: What does 'think high' mean?

options.text: Think of going up or doing better

questions.answer: Think of going up or doing better

questions.question: The sign (') used in words like 'can't' is called ______.
questions.answer: Apostrophe

questions.question: Why did man invent aeroplanes according to the text?

options.text: Because he thought he could fly

questions.answer: Because he thought he could fly

questions.question: What happens if you think you 'dare not'?
questions.answer: You don't

questions.question: What is the QR code text for Chapter 12?
questions.answer: X2ACIN

questions.question: What is the full form of 'you've'?
questions.answer: you have

questions.question: Which word is used to show belonging (possession) in the text?
questions.answer: fellow's

questions.question: If you like to win, but think you can't, it is certain ______.
questions.answer: you won't

questions.question: What does 'state of mind' mean?
questions.answer: The way someone thinks/feels

questions.question: When does a person win, soon or late?
questions.answer: When they think they can

questions.question: Identify the short form for 'do not' from the text.
questions.answer: don't

questions.question: In the poem, 'you've got to think high to ______'.
questions.answer: rise

questions.question: What does 'life's' stand for in the poem?
questions.answer: of life

questions.question: Which word is the short form of 'you will'?
questions.answer: you'll

questions.question: When are you beaten according to the poem?
questions.answer: You are beaten if you think you are.

questions.question: When are you afraid of doing something?
questions.answer: You are afraid of doing something when you think you dare not.

questions.question: When will you not win according to the poet?
questions.answer: You will not win if you think you can't, even if you like to win.

questions.question: When are you lost?
questions.answer: You are lost if you think you will lose.

questions.question: Where does success begin?
questions.answer: Success begins with a fellow's will.

questions.question: What should you do if you want to win a prize?
questions.answer: You must be sure of yourself before you can win a prize.

questions.question: Do you always win the first time?
questions.answer: No, you may not always win the first time; life's battles go to the man who thinks he can, soon or late.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'will' in the poem?
questions.answer: In this poem, 'will' means the power of a person's mind.

questions.question: Define 'state of mind'.
questions.answer: 'State of mind' is the way someone thinks or feels at a particular time.

questions.question: What does it mean to be 'outclassed'?
questions.answer: A person is outclassed when others are better than him or perform better than him.

questions.question: What does 'think high' imply?
questions.answer: It means to think of going up or doing better.

questions.question: Who is the 'man who wins' in the end?
questions.answer: The man who wins is the one who thinks he can.

questions.question: Why did humans invent aeroplanes?
questions.answer: Humans invented aeroplanes because man thought he could fly.

questions.question: What is an apostrophe used for in short forms?
questions.answer: An apostrophe is used to show that some letters in the words have been dropped.

questions.question: Give the full form of 'don't'.
questions.answer: The full form of 'don't' is 'do not'.

questions.question: Give the full form of 'can't'.
questions.answer: The full form of 'can't' is 'cannot'.

questions.question: Give the full form of 'won't'.
questions.answer: The full form of 'won't' is 'will not'.

questions.question: Give the full form of 'you'll'.
questions.answer: The full form of 'you'll' is 'you will'.

questions.question: Give the full form of 'you're'.
questions.answer: The full form of 'you're' is 'you are'.

questions.question: Give the full form of 'you've'.
questions.answer: The full form of 'you've' is 'you have'.

questions.question: What does 'fellow's' stand for?
questions.answer: It stands for 'of a fellow'.

questions.question: What does 'life's' stand for?
questions.answer: It stands for 'of life'.

questions.question: Where else is the apostrophe used besides short forms?
questions.answer: The apostrophe is also used with 's' to show possession, like in 'Meena's shoes'.

questions.question: List two examples of 'noun + 's' from the text.
questions.answer: Examples include 'fellow's' and 'life's'.

questions.question: How should you say 'We must win this match' according to the pointers?
questions.answer: You should say it as if you are nervous, afraid, or angry.

questions.question: What is the message regarding 'state of mind' in group discussions?
questions.answer: The discussion should focus on how 'state of mind' helps you try harder and do things better.

questions.question: Does success depend only on strength or speed?
questions.answer: No, success depends on one's will and state of mind, not just being stronger or faster.

questions.question: What is the relationship between thinking you are outclassed and actually being outclassed?
questions.answer: The poem states that if you think you are outclassed, you are.

questions.question: What must you do to 'rise'?
questions.answer: You've got to 'think high' to rise.

questions.question: Who wins 'soon or late'?
questions.answer: The man who thinks he can wins soon or late.

questions.question: Identify the apostrophe in 'Meena's shoes'.
questions.answer: The apostrophe is between 'a' and 's' in 'Meena's'.

questions.question: What is the core theme of the poem?
questions.answer: The core theme is that success is determined by one's attitude and self-belief.

questions.question: List three emotions mentioned for oral practice in the pointers.
questions.answer: Nervous, afraid, and confident are mentioned.

questions.question: What sentence is to be said 'confidently' in the pointers?
questions.answer: 'I will finish my homework in time' is one of the sentences.

questions.question: Is the man who wins always the faster man?
questions.answer: No, life's battles don't always go to the faster man.

questions.question: What is required to win a prize?
questions.answer: You have to be sure of yourself.

questions.question: How does the poet describe being 'lost'?
questions.answer: He says if you think you'll lose, you're lost.

questions.question: Complete the line: 'It's all in the...'?
questions.answer: It's all in the state of mind.

questions.question: What are the two sentences given for 'happy' and 'confident' practice?
questions.answer: 'I want to learn this song' and 'I will finish my homework in time'.

questions.question: What is the significance of 'out of the world we find' in the poem?
questions.answer: It suggests that in the real world, success is found to begin with one's will.
